# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width=10)
    words = split(str, " ")
    lines = []
    line = []
    line_length = 0

    for word in words
        word_length = length(word)
        if line_length + word_length + length(line) > text_width
            push!(lines, join(line, " "))
            line = [word]
            line_length = word_length
        else
            push!(line, word)
            line_length += word_length + 1
        end
    end

    if!isempty(line)
        push!(lines, join(line, " "))
    end

    return join(lines, "\n")
end

wrapped_text = wrap_string("This is a long string that needs to be wrapped so it fits nicely within a certain text width")
println(wrapped_text)
